text: thanks to some really interesting
studies over the past few years well you
know that you can really control how
your brain works just by playing a
simple video game like Tetris or candy
crush saga if you play one of these
games for between 3 minutes and 10
minutes you can intervene in a really a
pretty wide variety of problems so for
example if you have a craving and you're
thinking about junk food that you want
are cigarette and you're trying to quit
playing one of these games for three
minutes will reduce your cravings by 25
to 50 percent which studies show is
significant enough to help you change
behavior make healthier choices the
reason why it works is that craving
requires you to imagine what you want in
your mind's eye and if you can block
that mental image of what you're craving
with the mental imagery of a videogame
you can actually reduce a craving a game
like Tetris or candy crush saga is
really effective at this because if
you've ever played it you know when you
walk away you close your eyes you see
the tetris blocks falling still or you
see the candy crush it feels like you
want to keep swapping them in your brain
that's when you know that you've played
a game that it's sufficiently visually
intense that it's the right kind of game
so they found it not only can you
cravings that way you can actually block
anxiety that way because anxiety is what
you feel when you're imagining something
bad happening in the future so if you
can shut down your mind's eye from
picturing the bad things you can
actually stop anxiety stop panic attacks
same exact way and maybe most profoundly
the reset is at Oxford University have
shown that playing 10 minutes of Tetris
within 24 hours of a trauma can prevent
flashbacks and other symptoms of PTSD
because instead of the mind constantly
replaying the trauma that you witnessed
or experienced its replaying the stupid
video game and that prevents your brain
exceeding on the trauma this is really
remark what I suggest everybody should
have one of these games on their phones
or tablet so that they have a craving or
they're having anxiety or I hope never
but they have a trauma or experiencing
